results.definition: a period of time past the deadline for fulfilling an obligation during which a penalty that would be imposed for being late is waived, especially an extended period granted as a special favor
examples: The payment had originally been due on April 1 but we had a grace period which expired in June.

results.definition: a short prayer of thanks before a meal
a sense of propriety and consideration for others
examples: a place where the company of others must be accepted with good grace

results.definition: (Christian theology) the free and unmerited favor or beneficence of God
examples: God's grace is manifested in the salvation of sinners
there but for the grace of God go I

results.definition: make more attractive by adding ornament, colour, etc.
(Christian theology) a state of sanctification by God; the state of one who is under such divine influence
examples: the conception of grace developed alongside the conception of sin
it was debated whether saving grace could be obtained outside the membership of the church
the Virgin lived in a state of grace

results.definition: elegance and beauty of movement or expression
examples: a beautiful figure which she used in subtle movements of unparalleled grace

results.definition: a disposition to kindness and compassion
examples: the victor's grace in treating the vanquished

results.definition: (Greek mythology) one of three sisters who were the givers of beauty and charm; a favorite subject for sculptors
